name: papio
short_description:
Unit tests are an essential part of product development - the earlier a developer can detect a bug, the cheaper it is to fix. But unit tests are frequently built in such a way that developers are required to run the tests - they are unusable by testers without detailed knowledge of the tests themselves.

Papio seeks to simplify the way tests are run. Unit tests can now be put together  into sequences in a GUI and executed on demand. Results are gathered in a standard format.

The project will initially target Python tests, but it is expected that Java and .Net will soon follow. C++ testing might also be possible.
summary: A cross-platform, cross-language unit test driver system
